member.name: P:NDepend.CodeModel.IUser.Level
member.summary: Gets a numeric nullable value indicating whether this assembly, namespace, type or method depends on a dependency cycle.
member.remarks:
Level code metric description:
The Level value for a namespace is defined as follow:
Level = 0 : if the namespace doesnt use any other namespace.
Level = 1 : if the namespace only uses directly namespace defined in third-party assemblies.
Level = 1 + (Max Level over namespace it uses direcly).
Level = null : if the namespace is involved in a dependency cycle or uses directly or indirectly a namespace involved in a dependency cycle.
Level metric definitions for assemblies, types and methods are inferred from the above definition. This metric has been first defined by John Lakos in his book Large-Scale C++ Software Design.
Recommendations: This metric helps objectively classify the assemblies, namespaces, types and methods as high level mid level or low level.
There is no particular recommendation for high or small values. This metric is also useful to discover dependency cycles in your application.

member.name: T:NDepend.CodeQuery.IQueryCompiledUnresolved
member.summary: Represents the result of a query compilation no matter whether it was a successful compilation or not, unresolved yet to a code base.
member.remarks:
A code query can reference some code elements through string like in from m in Methods where m.IsUsing("System.String").
The resolving step aims at resolving these code elements from a code-base or a compare-context.
The reason for having IQueryCompiledUnresolved is performance. It takes much more time to compile a query than to resolve it to a code-base.
With , the result of a compilation can be re-used on several code-base if needed.

member.name: T:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryPersistenceKind
member.summary: Represent how the queries are stored in XML project files and XML rule files.

member.name: F:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryPersistenceKind.PersistOnlyQueryIdForUntouchedQueries
member.summary: Persist only a query Id and retrieve the default query text for this Id at load time.
member.remarks:
When a query text has been edited, the entire text is persisted to avoid losing any customization.
The advantage of this persistence kind is twofold: Not only project files and rule files are much smaller but also query gets updated with latest changes.

member.name: F:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryPersistenceKind.PersistAllQueriesAsPlainText
member.summary: Persist query plain text, no matter if it corresponds to a default query or not.

member.name: F:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryPersistenceKind.Default
member.summary: The default value is PersistOnlyQueryId.

member.summary: The value with no flag set.

member.name: F:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryResultExportFlags.UnfoldMultiItemsCell
member.summary: When this flag is set, cells of the query result that contain several items, like several code elements or several issues, are unfold in the result document.

member.name: F:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryResultExportFlags.ShowStatistics

member.name: F:NDepend.CodeQuery.QueryResultExportFlags.LinkElementToRelativeSourceFile
member.summary: When this flag is set, links to source file declarations in the report are paths relative to the report file location.

member.summary: This flag is used when exporting the query result to report. It is set when . is set.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this code query relies on a object.
member.remarks:
The returned value is independant from the fact that is null or not.
A code query that relies on a compare context and that is executed without a compare context won't return a useful result.
In such situation, at query runtime an empty object is provided, that returns null or false for all properties.

member.name: P:NDepend.CodeQuery.IQueryExecutionSuccessResult.IsSingleScalarResult
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the code query returned a single scalar result.
member.remarks:
Only CQLinq queries can return a scalar result through aggregation operators like Count() or Sum().
In such case is an empty collection.

member.name: P:NDepend.CodeQuery.IQueryExecutionSuccessResult.SingleScalarValue
member.summary: Gets the single scalar result returned by the query.
member.remarks:
Only CQLinq queries can return a scalar result through aggregation operators like Count() or Sum().
If is false, this property returns null.
If is true, this property might returns null if the CQLinq aggregation operation returned null.

member.name: P:NDepend.CodeQuery.IQueryExecutionSuccessResult.TargetCodeElements
member.summary: Gets code elements referenced in the query itself, like the code element named "XYZ" in "from t in Types where t.IsUsing("XYZ") select t".
member.remarks:
If a wildcard match expression is used, like "X*YZ" instead of "XYZ", the returned collection contains all matched code elements.
Targets code elements can be matched by following extension methods declared in .:
, , , , , , ,
, , , , , , , ,
, , , , , , ,
, ,

member.name: P:NDepend.CodeQuery.IQueryExecutionSuccessResult.MatchedCodeElements
member.summary: Gets a collection of code elements matched by the code query. If is true or if the query is matching issues or rules, gets an empty collection.
member.remarks:
This method is a facility to avoid extracting matched code elements from this. first column.
This extension method has a O(this..Count) time complexity.
Notice that a object can be modified when calling a . overload that takes a suppressedMessage set. In such condition the list of code-elements returned can be different than the one returned before calling GetIssues().

member.remarks:

This extension method has a O(this..Count) time complexity.

member.remarks:
This method is a facility to avoid extracting matched rules from this. first column.
This extension method has a O(this..Count) time complexity.

member.name: P:NDepend.CodeQuery.IQueryExecutionSuccessResult.MatchedQualityGates
member.summary: Gets a collection of matched by the code query. If is true or if the query is matching code elements or issues or rules, gets an empty collection.

member.name: T:NDepend.DotNet.IDotNetManager
member.summary: Exposes base operations concerning the .NET platforms versions installed, including getting .NET Fx installation directories. An instance of IDotNetManager can be obtained from the property ..

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.IDotNetManager.IsInstalled(NDepend.DotNet.DotNetProfile,System.Version)
member.summary: Returns true if the .NET profile version specified is installed on the current machine, otherwise returns false.
member.param: The version demanded, only the version major and minor numbers are taken account.

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.IDotNetManager.GetDotNetProfileVersionsInstalled(NDepend.DotNet.DotNetProfile)
member.summary: Gets the versions installed on the machine, for the specified .NET profile.
member.returns:
A sequence a versions of the profile supported on the current machine.
An empty sequence if no version of is installed on the current machine.
member.remarks:
Versions are returned in decreased order, higher version installed first.
Notes that NDepend needs at least .NET framework v4.0 to run, so the returned version for the profile must include v4.0 or above.
Only the version major and minor numbers are taken account.

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.IDotNetManager.GetDotNetProfileDirectories(NDepend.DotNet.DotNetProfile,System.Version)
member.summary: Gets a sequence of directory paths containing assemblies of the , specified .
member.returns:
Directory paths containing assemblies of the , specified .
An empty sequence if is not supported.
Some directories paths are returned even if of is not installed. In such case these directories doesn't exist.
member.remarks:
Only the version major and minor numbers are taken account.
Returns an empty set of directories if the is not a valid version.
member.param: The version demanded, only the version major and minor numbers are taken account.

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.VisualStudio.IVisualStudioManager.GetMostRecentlyUsedVisualStudioSolutionOrProject(NDepend.DotNet.VisualStudio.VisualStudioVersion)
member.summary: Returns a read-only list of most recently used Visual Studio solutions or projects file paths, for the specified .
member.remarks:
This list is stored in the registry and is used by the Start Page of Visual Studio. Returns an empty collection if the specified Visual Studio version is not installed.
This method can only be invoked within a .NET Framework 4.x and Windows OS context else it throws a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.VisualStudio.IVisualStudioManager.IsVisualStudioVersionInstalled(NDepend.DotNet.VisualStudio.VisualStudioVersion)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified Visual Studio version is installed on the current machine.
member.remarks: This method can only be invoked within a .NET Framework 4.x and Windows OS context else it throws a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.VisualStudio.IVisualStudioManager.ShowDialogSelectVisualStudioSolutionsOrProjects(System.IntPtr,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{NDepend.Path.IAbsoluteFilePath}@)
member.summary: Shows a dialog that lets the user select one or several Visual Studio solutions or projects files.
member.param: The window handle of the parent window that shows the dialog.
Visual Studio solutions or projects file paths choosen.
member.returns: True if the user clicked OK, False if the user clicked Cancel
member.remarks: This method can only be invoked within a .NET Framework 4.x and Windows OS context else it throws a NotSupportedException.
member.exception: This operation needs the current thread to be a STA thread. To do so, just tag your Main() method with the [STAThread] attribute.

member.summary: Returns true if the exists, and contains a that can be resolved to an absolute path.
member.remarks: If project attachment is done through the VS solutionn user options file (.suo) this method won't be able to retrieve the project attached. This method only deal with VS solution files (.sln).
member.param: The path to the Visual Studio solution file.
The path to the NDepend project file.

member.name: M:NDepend.DotNet.VisualStudio.IVisualStudioManager.TryGetNDependProjectFilePathAttachedToVisualStudioSolution(NDepend.Path.IAbsoluteFilePath,NDepend.Path.IAbsoluteFilePath@,System.String@)

member.remarks: If project attachment is done through the VS solutionn user options file (.suo) this method won't be able to retrieve the project attached. This method only deal with VS solution files (.sln).

The path to the NDepend project file.
If this method returns false, this string contains a plain-english description of the reason why a NDepend project file path cannot be resolved.

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Enterprise C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Preview C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise
member.remarks: This method can only be invoked within a .NET Framework 4.x and Windows OS context else it throws a NotSupportedException.

member.remarks: The .NET Fx v4.7.2 introduces a ToHashSet() extension method with the same signature. As a consequence this method has been marked as obsolete since NDepend v2018.1.1 and it is advised to use instead, to avoid ambiguous call error emitted by the compiler.

member.remarks: The .NET Fx v4.7.2 introduces a ToHashSet() extension method with the same signature. As a consequence this method has been marked as obsolete since NDepend v2018.1.1 and it is advised to use instead, to avoid ambiguous call error emitted by the compiler.

member.name: M:NDepend.Helpers.ExtensionMethodsSet.ToHashSetEx``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Creates an hashset from a IEnumerable<T>.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: An IEnumerable<T> to create an hashset from.
member.returns: An hashset that contains the elements from the input sequence.
member.remarks: This method exists since NDepend v2018.1.1 because the .NET Fx v4.7.2 introduces a ToHashSet() extension method with the same signature as the one in the NDepend.API. As a consequence ambiguous call errors are emitted by the compiler when using ToHashSet() in a .NET fx v4.7.2 (or upper) environment. ToHashSet() can still be used as a static method ExtensionMethodsSet.ToHashSet(...). To avoid any problem, a straightforward solution is to replace "ToHashSet()" with "ToHashSetEx()" in all your .ndproj and .ndrules textual files that contain your code queries and rules.

member.name: M:NDepend.Helpers.ExtensionMethodsSet.ToHashSetEx``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``0})

member.remarks: This method exists since NDepend v2018.1.1 because the .NET Fx v4.7.2 introduces a ToHashSet() extension method with the same signature as the one in the NDepend.API. As a consequence ambiguous call errors are emitted by the compiler when using ToHashSet() in a .NET fx v4.7.2 (or upper) environment. ToHashSet() can still be used as a static method ExtensionMethodsSet.ToHashSet(...). To avoid any problem, a straightforward solution is to replace "ToHashSet()" with "ToHashSetEx()" in all your .ndproj and .ndrules textual files that contain your code queries and rules.

member.name: T:NDepend.Issue.ISuppressMessage
member.summary: Represents a valid usage of in source code with the category "NDepend".
member.remarks:
Instances of this interfaces are produced at analysis time.
They can be obtained from ..

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.ISuppressMessage.RuleIdOrCategory
member.summary: Gets the rule-id or rule category that the corresponding usage of is relying on.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.ISuppressMessage.Scope
member.summary: The scope of code element(s) on which to suppress issues.
member.remarks:
If the returned value is ., issues are suppressed only for . and not for any of its child code element.
Else issues are suppressed eventually for . (if it is matched by the scope value) and the child elements defined by the scope.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.ISuppressMessage.CodeElement
member.summary: The code element on which to suppress issues.
member.remarks: Depending on the value of , issues can be suppressed only for this code-element, or for child of this code-element.

member.summary: Enumerate possible quality gate status.

member.name: T:NDepend.Issue.IIssuesSetDiff
member.summary: An issues-set-diff compares its and objects and makes convenient to browse diff information about issues, rule and code elements of these two issues sets.
member.remarks:
An issues-set-diff can be created through or .
An issues-set-diff gets filled through methods of available through .
An issues-set-diff is not thread-safe. It is safe to call read-only methods concurrently from several threads but it is not safe to call these methods and methods concurrently from several threads, this would provoke corrupted state and exceptions.
When an object compares two objects, the objects are not modified nor aware they are compared. As a consequence an object can be compared in several object.

member.name: T:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope
member.summary: Scope on which a object is applied.
member.remarks:
Scope can be use to ignore issues of a rule on all methods and fields defined in a type or in a namespace.
Several scopes can be provided in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope, separated with a space like "assembly namespace type".
Notice the special Scope value "deep" that means this code element and all its child code element.
For an assembly, Scope value "deep" means | | | | .
For a namespace, Scope value "deep" means | | | .
For a type, Scope value "deep" means | | .
For a method, Scope value "deep" means only (no child code elements for a method).
For a field, Scope value "deep" means only (no child code elements for a field).

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.ThisOnly
member.summary: Scope this-only means that corresponding issues are suppressed only for the ., and not for any of its child code element.

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.Module
member.summary: Scope Module (which means assembly wide), use the string "module" in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope.

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.Namespace
member.summary: Scope Namespace, use the string "namespace" in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope.

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.Type
member.summary: Scope Type, use the string "type" in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope.

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.Method
member.summary: Scope Method, use the string "method" in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope.

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.Field
member.summary: Scope Field, use the string "Field" in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope.

member.name: F:NDepend.Issue.SuppressMessageScope.Member
member.summary: Scope Member, use the string "member" in the SuppressMessageAttribute.Scope.
member.remarks: Member means methods and fields.

member.name: T:NDepend.Issue.IIssue
member.summary: An instance of this class represents an issue.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.Rule
member.summary: The rule from which the issue is inferred.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.CodeElement
member.summary: Gets the code element that has the issue.
member.remarks:
A code rule can rely on a object to query the diff between 2 snapshots of a code base, the newer snapshot and the baseline snapshot. For example rules to detect API breaking changes fall in this category. Such rule can match code elements in the baseline code base snapshot.
However the issue code element returned by this property necessarily belongs to the newer code base snapshot. In such situation is the matched code element declared in the baseline code base, and the code element returned by this property is the most inner parent code element of , that has an equivalent in the newer code base snapshot. For example if a removed method is matched, and its parent type hasen't been removed, this property returns its parent type declared in the newer code base.
Notice the particular case when the matched code element is an assembly removed or is a namespace/type/method/field declared in an assembly removed. In such situation there is no most inner parent code element that has an equivalent in the newer code base snapshot and this property returns the first application assembly of newer code base.
The reason an issue must be be declared in the newer code base snapshot, is because an object is related to a code base snapshot and not to the diff between 2 snapshots of a code base. It wouldn't make sense that an object contain some issues declared on elements of the baseline snapshot.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.CodeElementInBaseline
member.summary: Gets the code element declared in the baseline code base snapshot, that has the issue, or null.
member.remarks:
A code rule can rely on an object to query the diff between 2 snapshots of a code base, the newer snapshot and the baseline snapshot. For example rules to detect API breaking changes fall in this category. Such rule can match code elements in the baseline code base snapshot.
However the issue code element returned by necessarily belongs to the newer code base snapshot. In such situation this property returns the matched code element declared in the baseline code base, and the code element returned by is the most inner parent code element of , that has an equivalent in the newer code base snapshot.
If not in the situation, which means that the matched code element is declared in the newer code base snapshot, this property returns null.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.CodeElementInBaselineWasRemoved
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the code element declared in the baseline code base snapshot has no equivalent in the newer code base snapshot and thus, can be considered as removed..
member.remarks:
A code rule can rely on an object to query the diff between 2 snapshots of a code base, the newer snapshot and the baseline snapshot. For example rules to detect API breaking changes fall in this category. Such rule can match code elements in the baseline code base snapshot.
In such situation returns the matched code element declared in the newer code base, and returns the matched code element declared in the baseline code base. However if has been removed and thus, has no equivalent in the newer code base snapshot, the property returns the most inner parent code element of , that has an equivalent in the newer code base snapshot, and this property returns true to inform of this situation. If not in this situation, this property returns false.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.Debt
member.summary: The estimated technical-debt generated by this issue, or in others words, the estimated effort to fix the issue.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.AnnualInterest
member.summary: The estimated annual-interest generated by this issue, or in others words, the cost per year, to leave the issue unfixed.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.Severity
member.summary: The estimated severity of the issue.
member.remarks:
The severity of an issue is inferred from and thresholds in .
The method is used to obtain the severity.

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.BreakingPoint
member.summary: Gets the time point from now when the estimated cost-to-not-fix this issue will reach the estimated cost-to-fix this issue. This time point is named the breaking point.
member.remarks:
The breaking point is the issue divided by the issue .
For example if the estimated cost-to-fix the issue (this issue ) is equal to 10 man-days, and the estimated cost-to-not-fix the issue is equal to 2 man-days per year (this is this issue ) then the issue breaking point is equal to 5 years from now.
Notice that a breaking point lower than a year means that during the next 12 monthes, it would be cheaper to fix the issue than not to fix it.
If this issue is equal to , this getter returns ..

member.name: P:NDepend.Issue.IIssue.AnnualInterestPercent
member.summary: Gets this issue estimated annual interest percent, expressed in percent per year.
member.remarks:
This issue annual interest percent is equal to 100 multiplied by this issue divided by this issue .
For example if the estimated cost-to-fix the issue (this issue ) is equal to 10 man-days, and the estimated cost-to-not-fix the issue is equal to 2 man-days per year (this is this issue ) then the debt annual interest percent is 20% per year.
Notice that an annual interest percent higher than 100% means that during the next 12 monthes, it would be cheaper to fix the issue than not to fix it.
If this issue is equal to , this getter returns zero.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProject.SourceFilesRebasing
member.summary: Represents this NDepend project source files rebasing settings.
member.remarks:
SourceFilesRebasing is useful if the analysis results are produced on a machine, but used from another machine, where source file are nested in a different root directory.
Hence source files rebasing settings are used to rebase source files paths.

member.name: T:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze
member.summary: Represents application and third-party assemblies to analyze, of an NDepend project.
member.remarks:
Assemblies are referenced by names.
A collection of directories is provided.
At assemblies resolving time, assemblies are resolved by names in directories provided. Some can then occur.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze.IDEFiles
member.summary: Gets a read-only list of Visual Studio solution(s) or project(s) from which some application assemblies are inferred to be analyzed.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze.ApplicationAssembliesNames
member.summary: Gets a read-only list of application assemblies files names.
member.remarks: The list returned is a read-only clone. Hence it doesn't reflect any modification in the original collection.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze.RuntimeProfileDesc
member.summary: Get or set a string that describes the .NET runtime profile for assemblies of this project.
member.remarks: This value is used to infer runtime profile directories in which referenced assemblies are resolved at analysis time.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze.Directories
member.summary: Gets a read-only list of directories paths where to search for assemblies.
member.remarks: The list returned is a read-only clone. Hence it doesn't reflect any modification in the original collection.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze.DirectoriesAbsolute
member.summary: Gets a read-only list of absolute directories paths where to search for assemblies.
member.remarks:
Return a read-only list of resolved as absolute, in the context of the current machine and the current project.
In this situation, if a directory cannot be resolved to absolute (like for example the relative directory "..\..\Dir0" cannot be resolved from "C:\Dir1\Project.ndproj"), it doesn't appears in the returned collection of paths.
The list returned is a read-only clone. Hence it doesn't reflect any modification in the original collection.

member.name: M:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeToAnalyze.SetApplicationAssemblies(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{NDepend.Path.IAbsoluteFilePath})
member.summary: Set the collection of application assemblies to analyze.
member.remarks:
This method resets the for this project.
Third-party assemblies are inferred from these application assemblies and also application assemblies inferred from .
Directories (absolute or relative to the NDepend project file path) are inferred as well.
.NET Framework directories are also inferred.
member.param: The sequence of absolute file paths of the application assemblies to analyze.

This method resets the for this project.
Third-party assemblies are inferred from application assemblies inferred from and also from .
Directories (absolute or relative to the NDepend project file path) are inferred as well.
.NET Framework directories are also inferred.
member.param: The sequence of Visual Studio files from which some application assemblies are inferred to be analyzed.

member.summary: Try resolve application and third-party assemblies paths, and if some are not resolved, returns corresponding objects.
member.remarks: The result of this resolving action is not cached and each time calling this method can take a few tenths of second.
member.param: Paths to application assemblies files resolved.
Paths to third-party assemblies files resolved.
A read-only list of objects, one for each application assemblies files unresolved.
A read-only list of objects, one for each third-party assemblies files unresolved.
member.returns: Returns true if no assembly resolving error is found, otherwise returns false.

member.name: T:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage
member.summary: Represents settings of an NDepend project concerning code coverage file(s) to load to obtain code coverage metrics.

member.name: M:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.AddCoverageFile(NDepend.Path.IFilePath)
member.summary: Adds the coverage file path.
member.remarks: The list can't contains duplicate path. If the path is added, the event . is triggered with the flag . activated.
member.returns:
Returns true only if the path is correctly added.
When adding a duplicate path, the method does nothing and returns false.
member.param: The coverage file path to add.

member.name: M:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.RemoveCoverageFile(NDepend.Path.IFilePath)
member.summary: Removes the from the collection of coverage files.
member.remarks: If the path is removed, the event . is triggered with the flag . activated.
member.returns:
If the path is not found, the method does nothing and returns false.
Returns true only if the path is correctly removed.
member.param: The coverage file path to remove.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.CoverageFiles
member.summary: Gets a read-only list of coverages files paths.
member.remarks:
The list returned is a clone. Hence it doesn't reflect any modification in the original collection.
Use and methods to modify the collection of coverages files paths.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.CoverageDir
member.summary: Gets or sets a directory path that contains some coverage files to import. A null value means that this facility is not used.
member.remarks: In addition to the specified list of coverage files, a directory can be specified to import all files in this directory as coverage files. This facility is useful to just dump all coverage files in a directory at build time, and don't need to care about their number nor names. If some files in this directory are not recognized as coverage files, a warning will be emitted.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.CoverageExclusionFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a file path that contains some data to exclude some projects or some code elements from code coverage statistics.
member.remarks: In .NET a coverage exclusion file is a file with extension .runsettings file with a CodeCoverage section.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.CoverageDirFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a wildcard filter string that is used to locate coverage files when the is set.
member.remarks:
No filter means only files in coverage directory are taken account.
Filter "*" matches all files in coverage directory (same as above).
Filter "**\*.xml" matches all files with .xml extension (case-insensitive) in coverage directory and in all its child directories (recursive).
Filter "Cov*\*" matches all files in coverage directory's child directories whose name starts with Cov (case-insensitive).

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.UncoverableAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets the full name string of the uncoverable attribute.
member.remarks:
Through this option, the user can define an attribute that tags uncoverage methods, types or assemblies.
NDepend will then take care of this attribute and compute coverage ratio adequately.
For example, if all methods of a type are 100% covered by tests except a method that calls a blocking method such as MessageBox.Show(), this method can be tagged with the uncoverable attributes and as a result, the type. ratio is artificially maintained to 100%.
The NDepend.API offers the attribute class for default uncoverable attribute, but you can define your own uncoverable attribute and set this property adequately.
The name of the uncoverable attribute must be formatted "{namespace}.{typeAttribute}". For example: "NDepend.Attributes.UncoverableByTestAttribute"

member.name: M:NDepend.Project.IProjectCoverage.GetCoverageDescription
member.summary: Returns a plain english description of the coverage files.

member.summary: Gets or sets the output directory path of the NDepend project, the path where all analysis results will be stored.
member.remarks: When the output directory is changed, the event . is triggered with the flag . activated.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectProperties.FilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the NDepend project file path.
member.remarks:
It is not recommended to change the project file path if some paths referenced by the project are relative.
Indeed, in such situation most of directories and files referenced by the project are relative to the .
When the file path is changed, the event . is triggered with the flag . activated.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectProperties.TemporaryProjectMode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this project is a temporary project or not.
member.remarks: By working with temporary projects, you can create and experiment with a project without specifying a disk location or a project name.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectProperties.KeepXmlFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether at the end of an analysis, the XML files used to generate the report through a XSL transformation, are kept or not.
member.remarks: When the property is changed, the event . is triggered with the flag . activated.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectProperties.MergeCodeGeneratedByCompiler
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether at analysis time, types and methods generated by the C# and VB.NET compilers to handle language constructs like lambda, iterators, anonymous and asynchronous methods, are merged within their declaring methods.
member.remarks:
The default value is true. In most situations you'll want to avoid having to deal with such generated types and methods.
Anonymous types are not merged since they are explicitly created and used in the source code.
Types created by the Microsoft Code Contract infrastructure are not merged as well.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectProperties.ZipSourceFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether at analysis time source files get zipped.
member.remarks:
The default value is true. In most situations you'll want to zip source files. Having access to source files is especially useful when you want to diff particular changes in code.
However zipping source files consumes a bit of CPU at analysis time and a bit of hard drive space to keep the zip files for each analysis result.
So it might make sense to prefer no zipping source files.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectProperties.ProjectFileWrittenByProductVersion
member.summary: Gets the NDepend version that has written last time this project file.
member.remarks: This property appeared with NDepend version 7. All project written with a major version lower than 7 have by default the version 6.0.0.0.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectCodeQueries.CodeQueriesSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of code rules and queries for this NDepend project.
member.remarks:
If this NDepend project file exists, the set of code rules and queries data is loaded from and saved to the project file, each time this property getter or setter is invoked.
If this NDepend project file doesn't exist, the set of code rules and queries data is loaded from and saved to, in memory.
(property getter only) If this NDepend project file XML content is corrupted, the set of default queries is returned.
member.exception: (property setter only) The project file exists but cannot be written.

member.remarks: When the report XSL file path is changed, the event . is triggered with the flag . activated.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectReport.ReportOptionsFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of flags that indicates various boolean report options.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectReport.NbItemsToUnfold
member.summary: When the flag . is not-set, this value is used to know the maximum of items to unfold.

member.name: M:NDepend.Project.IProjectReport.RebaseSourcePathsInReport(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method can be called before analyzing with report creation, to update the paths in the report.
member.param: A sub-string of the source path that defines which portion to replace.
The portion replacement in the new path.
A string to append at the end of the path with the tag $LineNumber$ that is replaced with the line number. Empty string is accepted if the updated path shouldn't be suffixed with the line number.
member.remarks:
For example to transform this path:
C:\a\root\ClassLibrary\test.cs Line 76
to
https://github.com/myproject/testcore/blob/main/ClassLibrary/test.cs#L76
this method can be called with these arguments:
"root", "https://github.com/myproject/testcore/blob/main", "#L$LineNumber$"
Notice that the provided information are not stored in the project file.
They are just used on next calls to on this object.
member.exception: Such exception can be thrown if provided arguments are not valid.

member.name: T:NDepend.Project.IProjectDisabledWarnings
member.summary: Represents the collection of analysis time warnings disabled, of an NDepend project.
member.remarks: Disabling some warnings is useful to avoid being warned again and again with recurring warnings at analysis time.

member.name: P:NDepend.Project.IProjectDisabledWarnings.WarningsDisabled
member.summary: Get or set the set of warnings disabled for this project.
member.remarks:
If the project file exists, this data is loaded from and saved in the project file.
(getter only) If the project file is corrupted, an empty array is returned.
member.exception: The project file cannot be read or written.

member.name: T:NDepend.Project.ProjectException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a project related operation fails.
member.remarks:
Methods potentially throwing this exception are:
IProjectCodeToAnalyze.
IProjectManager.
IProjectManager.
IProjectManager.
IProjectRef.

member.name: M:NDepend.Project.ProjectException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: A message that describes the error.

member.name: T:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqIssuesSet
member.summary: Presents extension methods on rules and code elements, that provide a syntax friendly way to gather debt and issues data in CQLinq rules queries.
member.remarks:
These extension methods exist for CQLinq friendly syntax reasons and can only be called in a .
Indeed they all rely on a hidden object, hidden in CQLinq queries. This results in less syntax burden.
At CQLinq compilation time, the CQLinq compiler takes care of transforming calls to these extension methods into calls to methods of a object.
Indeed each of these extension methods, has an equivalent method defined by , that can be called from a program that consumes NDepend.API.

member.remarks: This property getter has a constant time complexity.
member.exception: This extension method cannot be called from a program consuming NDepend.API. In such context, the method . must be called instead.

member.name: T:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqCompare
member.summary: Presents extension methods on code elements, that provide a syntax friendly way to specify diff actions in CQLinq rules queries.
member.remarks:
These extension methods exist for CQLinq friendly syntax reasons and can only be called in a .
Indeed they all rely on a hidden object, hidden in CQLinq queries. This results in less syntax burden.
At CQLinq compilation time, the CQLinq compiler takes care of transforming calls to these extension methods into calls to methods of a object.
Indeed each of these extension methods, has an equivalent method defined by , that can be called from a program that consumes NDepend.API.

member.name: M:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqCompare.NewerVersion``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns the newer version of this object. This method can only be called in a , otherwise the method . must be called instead.
member.remarks:
If this code element is already the newer version, returns this code element.
If this code element has been removed and has no corresponding newer version, returns null.
In the context of a CQLinq compiled query, this method has a constant time complexity.
member.typeparam: T is the closed generic type, like in ICodeElement<IMethod> or ICodeElement<ICodeBase> for example.
member.param: This object. A object can be a or a object.
member.exception: This extension method cannot be called from a program consuming NDepend.API. In such context, the method . must be called instead.

member.name: T:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqDependency
member.summary: Presents extension methods on code elements, that provides a syntax friendly way to specify dependencies in CQLinq rules queries.
member.remarks:
These extension methods exist for CQLinq friendly syntax reasons and can only be called in a .
Indeed they all require a special resolving step prior to query execution, that resolves once for all code elements by name.
The user doesn't have to write this resolving code. This results in less syntax burden.
For each of these extension methods, there are one or several corresponding methods in , that can be called to get the same action done.
This pre-resolving step is weaved at CQLinq compilation time, the CQLinq compiler takes care of transforming calls to these extension methods to calls to their equivalent.
These extension methods cannot be called from a program consuming NDepend.API, since it would provoke the resolving step to be invoked for all code elements.

member.name: M:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqDependency.AllowNoMatch(System.String)
member.summary: Append the prefix "OPTIONAL:" to to precise to a method such as or , that takes a code element name string as argument, that if no code element is matched, no exception should be sent.
member.returns: prefixed with "OPTIONAL:".

member.returns: prefixed with "FROM_ASM{}".

member.returns: prefixed with "ASSEMBLY:".
member.exception: Two different code element kind prefixes cannot be inserted.

member.name: M:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqDependency.IsUsedBy(NDepend.CodeModel.IUsed,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if this is directly used by a whose is . This method can only be called in a , otherwise the method . must be called instead.
member.param: This object. A object can be a , , , , or object.

The of the code element user.
The string can contain wildcard '*' characters but cannot be just a single wildcard string "*".
If one or several code elements are matched by , this method has a used by any behavior.
If matchs several code elements of different kinds (like some assemblies and some namespaces) a compilation resolving error is emitted.
To solve this issue, the string can be prefixed with "ASSEMBLY:", "NAMESPACE:", "TYPE:", "METHOD:" or "FIELD:" to precise the kind of code element to match.
Alternatively, the string extensions methods , , , or can be used instead, to insert this prefix.
If no code element is matched by , the CQLinq query will emit a compilation error, except if is prefixed with "OPTIONAL:".
Alternatively, the string extensions methods can be used instead, to insert the "OPTIONAL:" prefix.
member.remarks:
If one or several code elements are matched by , they will be listed in .
In the context of a CQLinq compiled query, this method has a constant time complexity.

member.name: T:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqNaming
member.summary: Presents extension methods to match code elements and members by name, through regular expressions.
member.remarks:
These extension methods exist for CQLinq friendly syntax reasons and can only be called in a .
Indeed they all require a special regular expressions compilation step prior to query execution, that compiles once for all, specified regular expressions.
The user doesn't have to write this regular expressions compilation step. This results in less syntax burden.
For each of these extension methods, there are some corresponding methods in , that can be called to get the same action done.
This pre regular expression compilation step is weaved at CQLinq compilation time, the CQLinq compiler takes care of transforming calls to these extension methods adequately.
These extension methods cannot be called from a program consuming NDepend.API, since it would provoke regular expressions to be compiled for each code elements.

member.name: M:NDepend.Reserved.CQLinq.ExtensionMethodsCQLinqNaming.NameLike(NDepend.CodeModel.ICodeElement,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if this . string matches the regular expression . This method can only be called in a , otherwise the extension method . must be called instead.
member.param: This object. A object can be a , , , or object.

The regular expression is defined with the System.Text.RegularExpressions syntax.
The regular expression string can be suffixed with "\i" to specify the ignore case option.
member.remarks: In the context of a CQLinq compiled query, this method has a constant time complexity.
member.exception: This extension method cannot be called from a program consuming NDepend.API. In such context, the method . must be called instead.

member.name: M:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.ExtensionMethodsDebtUsableInCQLinq.BreakingPoint(NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Debt,NDepend.TechnicalDebt.AnnualInterest)
member.summary: Gets the time point from now when the estimated cost-to-not-fix the will reach the estimated cost-to-fix the . This time point is named the breaking point.
member.remarks:
The breaking point is the divided by the .
For example if the estimated cost-to-fix the is equal to 10 man-days, and the estimated cost-to-not-fix the is equal to 2 man-days per year (this is the ) then the breaking point is equal to 5 years from now.
Notice that a breaking point lower than a year means that during the next 12 monthes, it would be cheaper to fix the debt than not to fix it.
This method accepts . value for , in which case it returns .. If is zero, then this method returns a zero .
If the division leads to a too large value to be handled by , this method will return . or . depending on the sign of the too large value.
If is overflow or is overflow this method returns ..
member.param: The estimated cost-to-fix a set of issues, it can be negative in case of debt-diff value.
The estimated cost-to-not-fix per year a set of issue, it can be negative in case of annual-interest-diff value.

member.name: M:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.ExtensionMethodsDebtUsableInCQLinq.AnnualInterestPercent(NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Debt,NDepend.TechnicalDebt.AnnualInterest)
member.summary: Gets the estimated annual interest percent, expressed in percent per year.
member.remarks:
The annual interest percent is equal to 100 multiplied by the divided by the .
For example if the estimated cost-to-fix the is equal to 10 man-days, and the estimated cost-to-not-fix the is equal to 2 man-days per year (this is the ) then the debt annual interest percent is 20% per year.
Notice that an annual interest percent higher than 100% means that during the next 12 monthes, it would be cheaper to fix the debt than not to fix it.
This method accepts . value for , in which case it returns zero. If is overflow or is overflow this method returns 0.
member.param: The estimated cost-to-fix a set of issues, it can be negative in case of debt-diff value.
The cost-to-not-fix per year a set of issue, it can be negative in case of annual-interest-diff value.

member.name: T:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.AnnualInterest
member.summary: Represent the estimated cost-per-year, of an issue-not-fixed, in terms of developer time.
member.remarks:
The raw value of a annual-interest estimation is based on a time-span.
An object of type can be used to fomat the annual-interest estimation into man-days, man-months or money.
A level can also be obtained from a an issue value, through the method .. In CQLinq code rule, annual-interest values are obtained by casting explicitly a value to an value, or by naming a TimeSpan column AnnualInterest, in which case TimeSpan values are automatically converted to AnnualInterest values.
Also such annual-interest value obtained in a CQLinq rule context is multiplied by the ..

member.name: T:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity
member.summary: This enumeration defines the level of severity that an issue can have.
member.remarks: The severity of an issue depends on the the issue, expressed in man-time per year, and is obtained from the severity thresholds defined in .

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Low
member.summary: The severity level Low is used by issues that have a zero, or close to zero, value for .
member.remarks:
Issues with a Low severity level represents small improvements, ways to make the code looks more elegant.
The Broken Window Theory https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Broken_windows_theory states that: Consider a building with a few broken windows. If the windows are not repaired, the tendency is for vandals to break a few more windows. Eventually, they may even break into the building, and if it's unoccupied, perhaps become squatters or light fires inside..
Issues with a Low or Medium severity level represents the broken windows of a code base. If they are not fixed, the tendency is for developers to not care for living in an elegant code, which will result in extra-maintenance-cost in the long term.

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Medium
member.summary: An issue with a severity level Medium is a warning that if not fixed, won't have a significant impact on development.

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.High
member.summary: An issue with a severity level High should be fixed quickly, but can wait until the next scheduled interval.

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Critical
member.summary: An issue with a severity level Critical shouldn't move to production. It still can for business imperative needs purposes, but at worth it must be fixed during the next iterations.

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Blocker
member.summary: An issue with a severity level Blocker cannot move to production, it must be fixed.

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Info
member.summary: Use Severity.Low instead

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Minor
member.summary: Use Severity.Medium instead

member.name: F:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Severity.Major
member.summary: Use Severity.High instead

member.name: T:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Debt
member.summary: Represent the estimated debt an issue. Such estimation represents the technical debt generated by the issue.
member.remarks:
The raw value of a debt estimation is based on a time-span.
An object of type can be used to fomat the debt estimation into man-days, man-months, money or ratio or rate.
In CQLinq code rule, debt values are obtained by casting explicitly a value to a value, or by naming a TimeSpan column Debt (in which case TimeSpan values are automatically converted to Debt values.
Also such debt value obtained in a CQLinq rule context is multipied by the ..

member.name: M:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Debt.#ctor(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Build a value, based on the time-span .

member.summary: Get the raw time-span value of this estimated debt value.

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.Debt.IsOverflow
member.summary: Returns true if the internal ticks value of this debt value reached the positive or negative maximum autorized by ..
member.remarks: Minimum and maximum range for an value is a bit more than [-29 247 years ; +29 247 years].

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.NumberOfWorkDayPerYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of worked day per developer per year. This value is used to format and values in terms of man-years and man-months.
member.remarks: The default value is 240, which means 4 full weeks off and 48 full weeks worked.

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.NumberOfWorkHourPerDay
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of worked hour per developer work day. This value is used to format and values in terms of man-days.
member.remarks:
The default value is 8. A developer typically doesn't spend 8 hours per day coding (because of email, meeting, discussion...) but this is not relevant, since this setting is used to format the Debt values in terms of man-days.
This cost necessarily includes side-costs like email or meeting costs, that represent an incompressible fraction of the productive time.

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.A2B_RatingThreshold
member.summary: Returns the percentage of technical debt under which, a code element gets the A rating.
member.remarks: The default value is 5%. A2B is the only threshold that can be equals to 0.0. In such case, it means that any cost-fix leads to a rating B or worst.

member.remarks: The default value is 10%.

member.remarks: The default value is 20%.

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.D2E_RatingThreshold

member.name: M:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.SetRatingThresholds(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the various thresholds used to infer the . character value in the range of 'A' 'B' 'C' 'D' 'E', from the Debt Ratio of a code element.
member.remarks:
The . method returns a character in the range 'A' 'B' 'C' 'D' 'E'.
This rating value is obtained from the ratio of technical debt of the code element, and the various thresholds assigned by this method.
member.param: The A to B rating threshold of technical debt, used to infer the . character value, from the percentage of technical debt of a code element.
The B to C rating threshold of technical debt, used to infer the . character value, from the percentage of technical debt of a code element.
The C to D rating threshold of technical debt, used to infer the . character value, from the percentage of technical debt of a code element.
The D to E rating threshold of technical debt, used to infer the . character value, from the percentage of technical debt of a code element.

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.EstimatedNumberOfManDayToDevelop1000LogicalLinesOfCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the estimated number of man-days to develop 1.000 logical lines of code, as defined by .
member.remarks:
The debt ratio value of one or several issues on a code element, is obtained by this formula: 100 * estimated Debt of the issues / estimated effort to develop the code element.
The estimated Debt of the issues is the value.
The estimated effort to develop the code element is obtained from this EstimatedNumberOfManDayToDevelop1000LogicalLinesOfCode value, and from the code element number of logical lines of code.
The value of this setting is just an estimation, in the short-term it is meaningless.
After a few man-years of development, this value is typically stable enough to rely on, for estimation purposes.
This estimation also needs to take account of the cost of writing unit-tests. The default value is 18 man-days which means an average of 55 new logical lines of code, 100% covered by unit-tests, written per day, per developer.
Lines of code as expressed by is logical lines of code. This metric doesn't depend on formatting nor commenting and is inferred from # sequences points (gathered from PDB files).

member.name: P:NDepend.TechnicalDebt.DebtSettings.EstimatedEffortToDevelopOneLogicalLineOfCode

member.name: P:NDepend.Path.IVariablePath.AllVariables
member.summary: Gets all variables contained in this path, ordered from first one (the prefix variable) to the last one.
member.remarks: For example, for the path $(Variable1Name)\$(Variable2Name) this property getter returns ["Variable1Name","Variable2Name"].

member.summary: An array of char forbidden in string representing path.

Use this string.IndexOfAny(char[]) method to detect the presence of any of this char in a string.

member.summary: Determine whether this string is a valid file path or not.
member.remarks: If this method returns true, the extension method can be safely invoked on this string to obtain a . Notice that this method can return true even if the path represented by this string doesn't exist.
member.param: This string from which is determined the path validity.
If false is returned, failureReason contains the plain english description of the failure.
member.returns: true if this string represents a valid relative or absolute file path, otherwise false.

member.name: M:NDepend.Path.PathHelpers.IsValidEnvVarDirectoryPath(System.String)
member.summary: Determine whether this string is a valid directory path prefixed with an environment variable or not.

If this method returns true, the extension method can be safely invoked on this string to obtain a .
In addition to the the letters and digits, the following characters are accepted in the environment variable name _(){}[]$+-#',;.@!

member.name: M:NDepend.Trend.ITrendStore.SaveMetricValues(System.DateTime,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{NDepend.Trend.MetricValue},System.String)
member.summary: Save one or several dated metrics values, tagged with a label.
member.remarks:
If for one or several metrics in , values defined at already exist, they are overridden by the new values.
The date equality is defined if the two dates represent the same dated second, no matter the number of miliseconds.
member.param: The date of the metric values to save.

An optional label applied to this particular date.
Typically, the label represents the version of the product.
An empty string means that there is no label to store for
member.exception: contains some metrics with the same name.
An error occured while persisting in the trend store.

member.name: M:NDepend.Trend.ITrendStore.SaveMetricValues(System.DateTime,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{NDepend.Trend.MetricValue})
member.summary: Save one or several dated metrics values.
member.remarks:
If for one or several metrics in , values defined at already exist, they are overridden by the new values.
The date equality is defined if the two dates represent the same dated second, no matter the number of miliseconds.
member.param: The date of the metric values to save.
member.exception: contains some metrics with the same name.
An error occured while persisting in the trend store.

member.name: M:NDepend.Trend.ITrendStore.RemoveMetricValues(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Remove all metrics values stored at .
member.remarks: The date equality is defined by the same dated second, no matter the number of miliseconds.
member.param: The date of the metric values to remove.
member.exception: There is no metric values stored for or an error occured while persisting in the trend store.
